description:
It is a divine ritual, a martial art, a combat sport—it's sumo!!

A "small" new student, Ushio Hinomaru, appears before the weak little sumo club of Oodachi High School! The words "big" and "heavy" are the rules to this sport, which does not fit this newbie any inch, but this guy goes and does what...!? Ushio and the small sumo club climbs its way to the top!

The goal is Hinoshita Kaisan (A title for the highest rank in professional sumo, equivalent of Yokozuna)!

A fired up high school sumo tale—no retakes allowed!!

(Source: MangaHelpers)
synonyms: ฮิโนะมารุ ซูโม่กะเปี๊ยกฟัดโลก

node.description: Kawada was an assistant of the mangaka [Shinya Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/98535)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
Debuted as an art director of [Kurau Phantom Memory](https://anilist.co/anime/483/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

__Formed:__ August 29, 2016
__Genres:__ Rock (Loud Rock)

__Introduction:__
Happy Heads NANIYORI is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record label Pony Canyon (2018–), having previously been under record label NANIYORI RECORDS (2016–2018).

__Members:__
- [Sekihan](https://twitter.com/skeihan) (赤飯, せきはん) – vocalist
- [Pony Kingdom](https://twitter.com/PONIKINGDOM) (ぽにきんぐだむ) – vocalist, guitarist
- [324](https://twitter.com/sandai324) (みつよ) – guitarist
- [mao](https://anilist.co/staff/170495/mao) – bassist
- [Mito Mitsu](https://twitter.com/xxxmitxx) (ミト充) – drummer

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satoshi_higedan) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/satoshi_higedan)

Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.
